name: Hotel Cerere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved our stay at the Hotel Cerere in Paestum and highly recommend this hotel over their other hotel MEC Paestum. This hotel is small but perfect for couples. Small families have the option of booking the residence rooms. This hotel was a very cute boutique style hotel... very suitable for those who dislike the large, impersonal hotel chains.
reviews.title: Great Little Hotel - We loved it!

reviews.text: Rooms - the rooms were extremely clean and smelled great. The maids were very friendly and had left us little gifts. The TV only broadcasts CNN in English and the rest is Italian TV (you're not really in Italy to watch TV anyway). The room has a little fridge if you want to buy snacks that need to be refrigerated. The balconies are spacious and come with towel racks so you can hang your wet bathing suit and towel. The shower is small (no bathtub) and you have to wait 2 min before hot water comes out of the shower nozzle. There is also a safe for your valuables and passport.
reviews.title: LOVED THE STAY

reviews.text: My friend and I just returned from a one week stay in Hotel Cerere as part of a package from Transat Holidays. This hotel had a wonderful clean, modern, spacious feel. While I agree that this hotel would serve people who are driving through the Amalfi coast much better than those relying on public transportation we did not find it too much of an inconvenience to travel through the area. We were able to arrange transportation to all off the different areas we wanted to see, Pompeii, a drive throught the Amalfi Coast, Agropolis, 2 day stay in Rome etc. Our one challenge with the local bus transportation provided us with an opportunity to meet up with a local who willingly gave us a ride back to our hotel, and who provided us with many laughs on our ride back into Paestum.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay at Hotel Cerere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food at the hotel was fantastic, service was wonderful, special thanks to Natale, who patiently waited for us on many nights when we ran in late for dinner and who was always gracious. Also thanks to Luciano and Omar for their helpful tips and attention.
reviews.title: good and bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool was beautiful and the proximity to the beach was fantastic as well. As many have stated, there are lots of weddings at this hotel which to us seemed to add a festive air to our nights, after a day of touring it was wonderful to sit by the pool, listen to the music and enjoy a glass of wine as we watched the nights festivities.
reviews.title: Great jumping-point for Southern Italy..if you don't mind driving

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We fell in love with this charming hotel, and cannot wait to return on our next trip through Italy. There may be other hotels with easier access to the Amalfi coast, but rarely will you come across a hotel that will provide you with such wonderful customer service. The owner of the hotel, was alway visible and always took time to make us feel welcome, and to ensure we were enjoying our stay.
reviews.title: romantic honeymoon stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Nice - for Italians wanting a beach

reviews.text: We spent 2 weeks at the Hotel Cerere at the end of Sept. 2008 & really enjoyed our stay. The staff were friendly & helpful, the meals were delicious & the weather was perfect for visiting. We had booked at the residence as the rooms are bigger but we the residence is located 2 buildings away from the main hotel & going back & forth for meals was not convenient. So we moved to the hotel & found it very comfortable & clean and a good size for a European hotel room. The large balcony was very pleasant.
reviews.title: relaxing holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has a beautiful pool which is very sheltered so even at the end of Sept. we were able to enjoy the sun although the water was a bit cool. The beach is beautiful & only a 5 minute walk from the hotel and the chairs & unbrellas provided by the hotel were reallynice.
reviews.title: HoneyMoon at Hotel Cerere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had rented a car for most of the time we were there & were glad we did as the hotel location is not very convenient for public transport. With our GPS we managed to get around very well with no problems although the Amalfi coast was a challenge but elsewhere the driving was easy and the roads well marked.
reviews.title: A great time

likes.liked: — Food, Ease of access to public transportation
likes.disliked: — Lack of access to pool in the evenings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited Paestum, Mount Vesuvius, Pompeii, Capris, the Amalfi coast, the Cilento coast and it was all really interesting & beautiful.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Didn't Like the location

likes.liked: — The Dinners & service were truly 5 stars.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived in Rome and it is a long drive with not much to see.....would be better to land in Sorrento.
reviews.title: Best Food and Service

likes.disliked: — a bit far from train but could live with that......

description: The Hotel Cerere is an exclusive refined hotel, located at Paestum, just one kilometre from the archaeological area and the National Museum; at 350 meters from our private beach. Directly managed by the owners, the complex is made up of a central structure, containing 38 rooms ando 2 suite all with private balcony, air-conditioning, satellite TV, mini-bar, hairdryer and cable radio, and of an annexe, about 30 metres from the hotel, containing21 rooms and two-bedroom apartments with 4/5 beds. The hotel also has a tennis court, a 5-a-side soccer pitch, a semi-Olympic pool, a private parking area with surveillance, restaurant and private beach, equipped with parasols, sunloungers and changing cabins at just 200 metres away, easy to reach with the hotel minibus shuttle service. Open throughout the year, The Hotel Cerere also has a well-equipped conference hall, with a capacity of between 100 to 400 seats and spacious and elegant restaurant rooms with 100 to 500 places, which make the ideal setting for receptions and especially for wedding banquets. For quality of service offered and the professional attention and efficiency of the management, the Hotel Cerere is the ideal place for a comfortable and relaxing holiday a stone's throw from the limpid and clean sea, not far from some of the most popular resorts of national and international tourism, such as Capri, Pompeii, the Pertosa Grotto, Padula Priory and Naples.
